H0.text: Which monarch granted a royal charter to the British East India Company. James I

H1.text: Which monarch granted a royal charter to the British East India Company. Charles II

H2.text: Which monarch granted a royal charter to the British East India Company. George III

H3.text: Which monarch granted a royal charter to the British East India Company. QEI

A4.text: In 1609, James I renewed the East India Company's charter for an indefinite period.

A5.text: The Queen granted her charter to the British East India Company in 1600.

A6.text: by a series of five charters, Charles granted the East India Company the rights to autonomous government of its territorial acquisitions, to mint money, to command fortresses and troops, to form alliances, to make war and peace, and to exercise both civil and criminal jurisdiction over its possessions in the Indies.
